intro: Malacocarpus rubricostatus, commonly known as the red-costed malacocarpus, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its striking red veins on its leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. It is typically found in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its ornamental value has led to its cultivation in some horticultural settings.
